src:
Begini Alasan Andre Oktaviansyah Gagal Masuk Timnas U-19
06 Nov 2019, 04:56 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pelatih Timnas U-19 Indonesia, Fakhri Husaini, memulangkan tujuh pemain dari pemusatan latihan nasional (Pelatnas). Ia pun sudah mendapatkan 23 pemain yang akan tampil di Kualifikasi Piala AFC U-19 2020 di Jakarta.
Salah satu pemain yang gagal bermain masuk ke skuad utama ialah Andre Oktaviansyah. Fakhri menyatakan Andre merupakan salah satu pemain berbakat dan jebolan program PSSI, Garuda Select I.
Juru taktik berusia 54 itu menyebutkan pemanggilan Andre bersama enam pemain lainnya ke Pelatnas untuk memberikan warna berbeda di tim Garuda Muda. “Itu bisa menambah nilai kompetisi antar pemain. Kami memang harus memilih dari 30 menjadi 23 pemain,” kata Fakhri di Jakarta, Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Tujuh pemain yang dipanggil Fakhri selama proses seleksi ialah Andre Oktaviansyah (Tira Persikabo), Fadilah Nur Rahman (Diklat Ragunan), Serdy Hepyfano (PPLP Maluku Utara). Lalu Jarson Armandi (PPLP Papua), Taufik Alif Hidayat (PPLP Sumatra Barat), Ikhwan Ali Tanamal (PPLP Bogor), dan Fatur Alamsyah (Badak Lampung FC). Dua pemain yang lolos adalah Fadilah Nur Rahman dan Serdy Hepyfano.
Pelatih asal Aceh ini mengatakan pencoretan pemain dalam sepak bola adalah hal yang lumrah. Menurut dia, dalam menentukan pemain sudah ada indikator yang jelas, seperti fisik, teknik, taktik, dan mental. Melalui indikator itu bakal diperoleh pemain yang betul-betul siap.
Fakhri menyebut alasan memulangkan Andre karena terlalu lama beristirahat. Menurut dia, terjadi penurunan permainan dari Andre usai menjalani masa pemulihan dari cedera. Ia juga sempat mengalami trauma saat menjalani latihan.
Dari pengamatan pelatih, pemain kelahiran 23 Oktober 2002 ini terlihat keteteran mengikuti program latihan. “Ketika latihan dimulai, seluruh pemain harus memberikan 100 persen kemampuan terbaik. Ini yang mungkin tidak kelihatan bagi Andre karena baru selesai cedera,” tutur Fakhri.
Timnas U-19 berada di Grup K pada Kualifikasi Piala AFC U-19 2020. Tim Garuda Muda akan menghadapi Timor Leste di laga pertama pada Rabu, 6 November 2019.

IRSYAN HASYIM
text:
Here's the reason Andre Oktaviansyah Failed to Enter U-19 national team
Nov 6 2019, 04:56 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Indonesian U-19 national team coach, Fakhri Husaini, sent home seven players from the national training camp (Pelatnas). He also has 23 players who will appear in the AFC U-19 2020 Qualification Cup in Jakarta.
One of the players who failed to play into the main squad was Andre Oktaviansyah. Fakhri said Andre was one of the talented players and a dropout of the PSSI program, Garuda Select I.
The 54-year-old tactician mentioned Andre's call with six other players to Pelatnas to give a different color to the Garuda Muda team. "That can add value to the competition between players. We really have to choose from 30 to 23 players, "said Fakhri in Jakarta, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Seven players who were called by Fakhri during the selection process were Andre Oktaviansyah (Tira Persikabo), Fadilah Nur Rahman (Ragunan Education and Training), Serdy Hepyfano (North Maluku PPLP). Then Jarson Armandi (PPLP Papua), Taufik Alif Hidayat (PPLP West Sumatra), Ikhwan Ali Tanamal (PPLP Bogor), and Fatur Alamsyah (Badak Lampung FC). Two players who passed were Fadilah Nur Rahman and Serdy Hepyfano.
The Aceh-based coach said the crossing of players in football was common. According to him, in determining the players there are already clear indicators, such as physical, technical, tactic, and mental. Through these indicators will be obtained by players who are really ready.
Fakhri said that the reason for repatriating Andre was because he had rested too long. According to him, there was a decline in Andre's game after undergoing a period of recovery from injury. He also experienced trauma while undergoing training.
From the observation of the coach, the player who was born October 23, 2002 was seen keteteran following the training program. "When training starts, all players must give 100 percent their best abilities. This may not be apparent to Andre because he has just finished his injury, "said Fakhri.
The U-19 national team is in Group K in the AFC U-19 2020 Qualification Cup. The Garuda Young Team will face Timor Leste in the first match on Wednesday, November 6, 2019.

IRSYAN HASYIM
